etymology.interpretation: Silk/thread (糸) evokes fineness and lack of mixture, while 屯 supplies the sound. The image of even, single-strand thread extends to meanings like “pure, unmixed” and by extension “solely/exclusively.”
etymology.simplification: Semantic 糸 was simplified to 纟 as part of the general silk-radical reduction; the phonetic 屯 was kept unchanged.

examples.chinese: 她有一颗纯真的心(她有一顆純真的心)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǒu yì kē chúnzhēn de xīn.
examples.english: She has a pure and innocent heart.

examples.chinese: 纯棉衣服很舒服(純棉衣服很舒服)。
